item.title: [423] Oblivion Remastered - Good??
item.description:
Never played this when it came out. Playing the remaster now. Why does this game actually BTFO Skyrim?

>actual magic system with some amount of depth
>combat actually feels better than Skyrim? It feels easier to die if you're not properly blocking, enemies actually respond when you hit them etc (might have been an addition of the remaster not sure)
>acrobatics and athletics are awesome and let you feel your character becoming more fit and physically adept as you jump around
>towns feel like they are actual little communities where people know and speak to each other and each has their own unique guild chapters with their own quirks
>joining a guild takes a lot of time and effort and involves a lot of quests that are actually relevant to what the guild is about (ie using actual stealth when assassinating people, using actual magic to become a mage)
>the world is soulful and tranquil, has a feeling of whimsy and serenity that nothing in the genre has matched in recent memory which reminds me of how I looked at classic fantasy as a child
>can customize your own wizard tower and undersea grotto
>Shivering Isles expansion is surreal and feels like a legitimate LSD trip

It's kino. Oblivionchads I kneel.

Original filename: SOVL.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

The EU military will be the one ruling the seas

People across the world will invest their money in the STOXX 600
Frankfurt will be the new New York
Brussels will be the new DC
Spain will be the new Florida
Ukraine will be the new Great Plains
The Lapland will be the new Alaska

And America will become hopeless, brown and poor

item.title: [219] /iemg/ & /pmpg/ - In-Ear Monitor & Portable Music Player General
item.description:
Evergreen goat edition
How to request advice:
>Budget
>Intended use (media, source, environment)
>Frequency response preference and music examples
>Past gear and your thoughts on them

FAQ:
>Where do I buy IEMs?
Amazon, Aliexpress, Linsoul, Hifigo, Shenzhenaudio

>Shopping Guide (IEMs, Cables, Ear Tips, etc.):
https://rentry.org/consoomer_guide

>EQ Guide (Measurements, Targets, Equalizer, etc.):
https://4ciemg.github.io/IEM-EQ-Guide/

>/iemg/'s Blog/Wiki:
https://4ciemg.github.io/IEMGazette/

>Frequency Response Graph Tool
squig.link

>Budget Wire Over-Ear IEMs:
• Tanchjim Bunny (Mild U) - $20
• Truthear Gate (Neutral) - $23
• EPZ Q1 Pro / G10 (V-shape) - $35
• Kiwi Ears Cadenza (Warm Neutral) - $35
• Simgot EA500LM (Bright Neutral) - $70

>Bullet IEMs:
• Tanchjim ONE DSP (Neutral) - $28
• Etymotic ER2XR (Neutral) - $140

>Flathead Earbuds:
• Blue Vido (Warm) - $5
• Faaeal Iris 2.0 (Warm) - $10

>USB-C DACs:
• JCALLY JM20 - $22
• Tanchjim Stargate II (8-Band PEQ) - $38
• Fosi Audio DS2 2024 (CS43131) - $45
• Qudelix 5K (20-Band PEQ/GEQ) - $110

>PMPs:
• HiBy R1 - $85
• Hifi Walker H2 / Surfans F20 (Rockbox) - $120
• HiBy M300 - $200
• Hidizs AP80 Pro-X - $200

>AVOID USING:
• Mainboard audio when using multi-driver pos

Previous Thread: >>105076415

item.title: [244] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Sunday - Round 8 concludes
item.description:
Sunny days edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Canberra Raiders v Redcliffe Dolphins
2:00pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
GIO Stadium, Canberra
1.51-2.58
>A clash between two of the NRL’s early-season surprise packets awaits as the Raiders aim to continue their surge up the ladder against the in-form Dolphins. Canberra enters round 8 off the back of a 30-20 win over the Titans, which has catapulted them into third place on the ladder with a 5-2 record. The Dolphins are riding a wave of momentum after notching three straight wins. None were more impressive than last week’s 42-22 dismantling of Melbourne. This will be the fourth ever meeting between these sides. In their lone clash last year, the Raiders prevailed 26-25.
Raiders 1-12 2.90
Raiders 13+ 2.60
Dolphins 1-12 3.70
Dolphins 13+ 6.50
Raiders -5.5 1.85 Dolphins +5.5 1.96

>GAME 2
Wests Tigers v Cronulla Sharks
4:05pm AEST on Ch9, Fox and Kayo
Leichhardt Oval, Sydney
2.74-1.46
>Round 8 ends with the NRL return of Lachie Galvin where he made his home debut at Leichhardt Oval in 2024. The Tigers slipped to 12th on the ladder after a 38-22 defeat to Parramatta in a wild Easter Monday showdown. It was a performance full of effort but lacking in execution, continuing a theme of near-misses for Benji Marshall’s outfit. The Sharks have found some rhythm. A convincing 34-14 win over the Knights last week marked back-to-back victories for the second time this season and showcased the attacking spark and defensive structure that have made them a finals threat in recent years. Cronulla has had a stranglehold over this fixture in recent times, winning 11 out of 13. The Tigers did pull off an upset at this very ground last year with a 26 point victory.
Tigers 1-12 3.80
Tigers 13+ 7.25
Sharks 1-12 2.85
Sharks 13+ 2.55
Tigers +6.5 1.90 Sharks -6.5 1.90

SUPER LEAGUE
>GAME 1
Hull FC v Wigan
0:00am (Monday) AEST on Fox and Kayo
4.00-1.24
>The Wigan Warriors look to make it four on the trot as they arrive in Hull for a top of the table clash

Original filename: sunnydayz.jpg

item.title: [ 55] /jpg/ - Japan General
item.description:
Kagura Edition

ー How do I travel by public transportation? ー
Use Google Maps within cities, install the Jorudan or Navitime app for intercity travel

ー What should I see in <place>? ー
https://www.wikivoyage.org/
https://www.japan-guide.com/
https://www.jnto.go.jp/
>Solid general guides - sights, sample itineraries, pre-travel considerations, etc
https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=1fmfaySQHmojbRGKWCwRecq6Ln1Bb2Xdh&ll=35.67928012473078%2C139.68638283648374&z=12
*You should check on google if a place is still in business before you plan to visit it*

ーJR Passー
Since JR has adjusted the prices for the pass, not really worth it anymore, unless you want to travel by train very extensively. You can plug in your itinerary in the links below and compare prices to the JR Pass.
>https://japantravel.navitime.com/en/area/jp/route/
>https://world.jorudan.co.jp/mln/en/
With the increased price of the JR Pass, local train passes might be good deals now.
>https://www.japan-guide.com/e/e2357.html

New prices starting May 2024
>7 day Pass: ¥50,000
>14 day Pass: ¥80,000
>21 day Pass: ¥100,000
https://www.japan-guide.com/railpass/

ーInfo on Degeneracy ー
READ THE INFO LISTED HERE. STOP TALKING ABOUT IT IN THE THREAD.

>https://chn.cityheaven.net/
>https://rockitrisingsun.com
>https://paradise-tokyo.net
>https://hentaitokyo.com
>https://tokyoadultguide.com/

Previous: >>2773718

Original filename: photo.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [112] /SWF/ - Semper ViVet Flash
item.description:
Semper ViVet Flash

Flash will live forever
/f/ will live forever

It is a travesty that this day has come, that the 4chan administration has decided to kill /f/ of all places they could.

But we won't back down. They're wrong about their paranoia, swfs are not unsafe through ruffle especially, but we can still help them.

ITT we organize an effort to revive flash.

We will rebuild the backend for /f/ beyond just the php scripts to build the webpages.

I honestly don't know how far we can get because I can't even think WHY the 4chan team would think swfs are a vulnerability for their infrastructure when the execution is handled by ruffle they serve client side, but we can still make an effort to build the most secure imageboard from every avenue we can find.

/f/ is a small community and not very technically proficient. Admittedly, I myself have done little in the way of webdev and thus we need support from /g/entoomen to help us overcome this ordeal.

I would naturally wait for someone more competent to take up the banner, but in this grave emergency, inaction is impossible.

Possible steps we can take:
>If the execution of flashes somehow happens serverside to some degree or if the Loader requests are indiscriminately answered, we can transfer all the burden client side.
>Since /f/ doesn't even support more than one file, build a version of rust with the Loader and MovieClip's Load APIs neutered
>Build a new verification library for flash, that safely decompresses and analyzes the Tag stream and P-code without executing anything to ensure it's not some other payload made to look like an swf.

Ruffle in general is very secure, so again, I don't even see why the concern is there, but acting antagonistically to the admin team will not help our cause.

Efforts organized at:
https://github.com/flash-computer/Semper-ViVet-Flash/

Original filename: 1725348055035726.png
item.author: /f/ Revival Project

item.title: [142] Official Win-O'-Thread
item.description:
>What is this thread?
Every Wins'day at Win-O'-Clock we gather here and post links to the latest scans and rips of comic books.
Most links we uploaded ourselves, others we are sharing from elsewhere.
Some comics we've even purchased ourselves (but most we didn't).
If you'd like to help out, just ask and we would be delighted to tell you how.
Otherwise, be patient, be polite, and understand the simple concept behind these words: Not posted means not available yet.

>Where can I find old Win-O'-Threads?
http://desuarchive.org/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
http://boards.fireden.net/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
(Note: This finds the OP for old threads. If you want to search for comics in the archive, clear the subject field!)

>Where can I find downloads for other comics?
Warez forums/blogs, DDL-indexing search engines (like FilesLoop), torrent trackers (like 1337x) and other P2P networks (like DC++).
If a link has been posted on 4chan, you can search for it in the Desu archive (add "http*" to searches to return only posts with links).
If all else fails, just >buy it.

>Where can I buy comics?
http://www.amazon.com/
On the various publishers' webstores, and at your local comics shop.

>Where can I find an LCS?
http://www.comicshoplocator.com/

>Where can I find out when new comics are released?
http://www.comiclist.com/index.php
http://www.previewsworld.com

>How do I download from websites that only give me .exe files?
Untick the checkbox under the download button.

>How can I find this thread every week?
If you are using the inline extension go to http://4chan.org/co/official or use the option under "Filters & Post Hiding".
If you have 4chanX go to Settings > Filter > Subject and add the following line:
/Official Win-O'-Thread/;highlight

>And last but not least
Did anyone rip any mango these last two weeks?

Original filename: hydra.png

item.title: [ 64] THE MOST FORGOTTEN POKÉMON
item.description:
This is it. Here you have it. This little shit is the most forgettable Pokémon as of 2025.

It's a gen 4 Pokémon so it didn't exist in the first 3 gens. It can't be caught in the wild in any game and barely if at all any trainers use it in the gens that it appears in (4, 5, 6, 7). And that's another one: it can't even be obtained in the last two gens (8, 9).

The design, typing, abilities and stats are all unremarkable, and it's just another bug/flying mon.

The counterpoints are that it's part of a branched evolution, as only male burmy can evolve into mothim, while females will evolve into wormadam, another arguably forgotten Pokémon. Nevertheless, burmy is rare enough (and male burmy even more so), as it can't be caught in gens 5 and 7, and it's very rare in HGSS and XY.

In addition (unlike wormadam) even if burmy has different forms, they're aren't preserved when they evolve into Mothim.

This gender exclusive evolution gimmick doesn't make it remarkable enough, especially not now when we have 1025 Pokémon, and when a ton of them have gimmicks of their own.


>inb4 some faggot suddenly appears claiming that this garbage is actually his fave mon and that it's not forgotten at all all and that [wrong answer] is actually the most forgotten one

Stfu retard no one has mothim as their favorite, not eve in the top 10, I refuse to believe it.

Original filename: mothim.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 97] /XMR/ Monero General
item.description:
Welcome to the /XMR/ Monero General, dedicated to the discussion of the world's most widely adopted privacy coin.

Monero payments are anonymous, low-fee by design and fully fungible, meaning users can send XMR globally without issue and receive XMR without having to worry about tainted coins. Battle-tested privacy tech (Ring Signatures, Stealth Addresses and RingCT) ensures that critical TX data cannot be gleaned from the Monero blockchain. Thus by default, the TX history of all Monero users is kept hidden from the prying eyes of adversaries, with TXs being optionally transparent via the aid of a view key.

Monero algorithmically ensures low TX fees by employing a dynamic (elastic) block size that can "stretch" to easily accommodate sudden TX spikes.

Monero's bespoke mining algorithm, RandomX, is optimized for devices using general-purpose CPUs e.g. desktops, laptops, smartphones, tablets, keeping the barrier to entry low and ASICs out of the equation.

Monero's tail emission - 0.6 XMR every block forever - financially incentives for-profit miners to keep mining, helping boost long-term network security. This constant linear inflation asymptotically trends to zero and is offset somewhat by a steady rate of coin loss.

Monero has thus far proven to be the only altcoin capable of overcoming BTC's network effect by driving it out of the darknet economy BTC dominated for over 10 years. Monero is now also starting to overtake BTC in clearnet commerce as well. See below.

If you still have questions, feel free to ask and a MoneroChad will be with you shortly.


XMR Redpill: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=wq6w03E2DS4

XMR Resources: https://libereco.xyz/resources/

XMR Stats: moneroj.net

USE XMR: https://cryptwerk.com/pay-with/xmr/

OFFICIAL WEBSITE - getmonero.org

WHERE TO BUY XMR: https://i.imgur.com/XdppsQ7.png
Crypto ATMs: see kycnot.me

>MINING
archive.is/TWOah

HOW TO STORE MONERO?

>Desktop
Official GUI/CLI
Featherwallet

>Mobile
IOS: Cakewallet
Android: Monerujo

item.title: [181] /out/ings with a pipe
item.description:
Old thread: >>2774508

This is a thread for enjoying a pipe while doing outdoor activities. If you ask why this belongs on /out/, you've never spent an evening by the campfire with a pipe silently enjoying the nature around you, and you're missing out.

>how to get started
Purchase a Missouri Meerschaum Legend and a pouch of Half and Half or Captain Black tobacco, available at most smoke shops. You will need a lighter or match, and something to tamp it with--a large nail works well if you don't have a pipe tool. Fill the pipe with tobacco, pack it down halfway, top it off, pack it down to 3/4, top it off again, pack gently and enjoy. Smoke slower than you think you need to, the tobacco tastes best when it is burning cool. Tamp and re-light as needed. If you still have trouble, try different methods on YouTube until you find one that works for you.

>smoking a pipe will give you cancer
While any tobacco consumption comes with some risk, the cancer risks from occasional pipe use are pretty minimal. Educate yourself and make your own informed health decisions. Some info here https://aacrjournals.org/cancerpreventionresearch/article/10/12/704/46541/Association-between-Cigar-or-Pipe-Smoking-and

>muh weed
Not the time or place. Start your own thread

>I DON’T LIKE WHAT YOU LIKE REEEEEE
Then leave the thread. Pipes have been a part of outdoors culture for centuries. If you don’t like it, leave.

Original filename: 0687fd190525af3678814c5f459c2d0a.jpg
item.author: Anonymous
